results.title: [Compilation. No. 01]
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short silent films featuring newsreel footage on the following: 1. Charles Lindbergh’s triumphant public receptions after his Transatlantic flight - in Paris, Brussels, London, Washington DC and New York. Presentation by President Coolidge of Distinguished Flying Cross (Kinnogram Films). 2. Footage of koalas with explanatory intertitles (Kodak Australia). 3. Footage of kangaroos, wallabies, bandicoots etc with explanatory intertitles (Development and Migration Commission).

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions

video_links.name: Is it always right to be right?

results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge. Bondi. Sydney Bush. Cars
results.brief_description: A compilation of four experimental films made by filmmaker, Paul Winkler, between 1977 - 1980: “Sydney Harbour Bridge”, “Bondi”, “Sydney Bush” and “Cars”.

results.title: Wild about wilderness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: Deborah Conway hosts this video which attempts to define wilderness areas that are left. All wilderness areas shown are from New South Wales. Finishes with the sobering thought that what we don’t save now is lost for ever.

results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth O'Neill, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth O’Neill, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: Building for learning
results.brief_description: As the Victorian population increases, the problem of providing school buildings and accomodation becomes more and more accentuated. The purpose of this film is to show the progress being made in this regard, and the problems associated with the building shortage. It also demonstrates the work being done in the various departments of the school and provides a valuable opportunity of showing to children, teachers, parents and other interested adults just what is being done in Victoria to meet the demands of a growing population for the best and the latest in the educational field. Commentary by Max Meldrum, drawings by Betty Jope.

video_links.name: Computers as Work Aids in Transport

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert in the field discusses the rise of computers as work aids in transport, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne Oct.16-18,1980
